block.p: Elizabeth Mary Mahon, a daughter of Kathleen and John J. Mahon of Edison, N.J., was married yesterday to Antonio Javier Fiol-Silva, the son of the late Petrin Silva de Fiol and Antonio Fiol-Bigas. The Rev. Edward C. Puleo officiated at St. Francis of Assisi Roman Catholic Cathedral in Metuchen, N.J.

The bride, who is keeping her name, is a partner in Mahon Wong Associates: Architects, in Cambridge, Mass. She graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and received a master's degree in architecture from Yale University.

Elizabeth Mary Mahon, a daughter of Kathleen and John J. Mahon of Edison, N.J., was married yesterday to Antonio Javier Fiol-Silva, the son of the late Petrin Silva de Fiol and Antonio Fiol-Bigas. The Rev. Edward C. Puleo officiated at St. Francis of Assisi Roman Catholic Cathedral in Metuchen, N.J.

The bride, who is keeping her name, is a partner in Mahon Wong Associates: Architects, in Cambridge, Mass. She graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and received a master's degree in architecture from Yale University.

The bridegroom is a senior urban designer at Domenech Hicks & Krockmalnic, an architectural firm in Boston. He is currently working in San Juan, P.R., as the manager of urban design for the Tren Urbano Project, a new mass-transit system in San Juan. He graduated from Cornell University and received a master's of architecture degree in urban design from Harvard University. He was a Fulbright Fellow in Barcelona, Spain, from 1992 to 1993.
